<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 356, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 259, 455, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 322, 390, 338]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 351, 828, 366]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 367, 722, 383]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 325, 399]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 447, 284, 462]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 590, 510]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 606, 526]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 540, 606, 555]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 556, 756, 572]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 572, 440, 588]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 588, 907, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 421, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(|x + 1|< |3x + 5|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 120, 92, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 128, 675, 285]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 303, 873, 323]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = x^{4} + 2x - 9\). The curve cuts the positive \(x\)-axis at the point \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 336, 151, 354]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 336, 737, 354]]<|/det|>
Verify by calculation that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) lies between 1.5 and 1.6.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 336, 920, 354]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 365, 153, 384]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 365, 586, 384]]<|/det|>
Show that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) satisfies the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 388, 566, 428]]<|/det|>
\[x = \sqrt[3]{\left(\frac{9}{x} - 2\right)}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 400, 920, 419]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 443, 151, 462]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 443, 361, 462]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 463, 576, 504]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = \sqrt[3]{\left(\frac{9}{x_n} - 2\right)}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 504, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
to determine the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 521, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 568, 94, 587]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 567, 920, 602]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y = \frac{1}{2}\mathrm{e}^{2x} - 5\mathrm{e}^{x} + 4x\). Find the exact \(x\)-coordinate of each of the stationary points of the curve and determine the nature of each stationary point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 584, 920, 603]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 630, 92, 648]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 630, 148, 648]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 630, 920, 680]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(x^{3} + ax^{2} + bx + 8\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants, is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). It is given that when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x - 3)\) the remainder is 14, and that when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x + 2)\) the remainder is 24. Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 664, 920, 682]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 692, 153, 710]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 692, 920, 727]]<|/det|>
When \(a\) and \(b\) have these values, find the quotient when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x^{2} + 2x - 8\) and hence solve the equation \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 711, 920, 728]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 755, 96, 772]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 755, 438, 772]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[364, 781, 630, 800]]<|/det|>
\[x = \cos 2\theta -\cos \theta ,\quad y = 4\sin^{2}\theta ,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 808, 230, 826]]<|/det|>
for \(0\leqslant \theta \leqslant \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 839, 153, 858]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 839, 384, 866]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{8\cos\theta}{1 - 4\cos\theta}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 845, 920, 863]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 880, 153, 897]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 878, 744, 897]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the point on the curve at which the gradient is \(-4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 880, 920, 897]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 200, 92]]<|/det|>
Find

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[163, 101, 193, 127]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 98, 311, 136]]<|/det|>
\[\int \frac{\mathrm{e}^{2x} + 6}{\mathrm{e}^{2x}}\mathrm{d}x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 108, 918, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 147, 196, 171]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[208, 144, 306, 175]]<|/det|>
\[\int 3\cos^{2}x\mathrm{d}x.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 153, 920, 171]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 189, 146, 208]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 189, 662, 208]]<|/det|>
Use the trapezium rule with 2 intervals to estimate the value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 214, 567, 260]]<|/det|>
\[\int_{1}^{2}\frac{6}{\ln(x + 2)}\mathrm{d}x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 268, 537, 288]]<|/det|>
giving your answer correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 268, 920, 287]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 313, 97, 332]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 313, 920, 349]]<|/det|>
(i) Express 3 \(\cos \theta + \sin \theta\) in the form \(R\cos (\theta - \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0^{\circ}< \alpha < 90^{\circ}\), giving the exact value of \(R\) and the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 331, 920, 349]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 361, 153, 380]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 361, 363, 380]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[413, 380, 583, 400]]<|/det|>
\[3\cos 2x + \sin 2x = 2,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 403, 546, 423]]<|/det|>
giving all solutions in the interval \(0^{\circ}\leqslant x\leqslant 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 405, 920, 424]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 75, 564, 90]]<|/det|>
